Headline: Redefining Nutrition To Maximize Human Potential! Be You, Be Wellversed! On a mission to transform 1 billion lives
Comment: It's great to see that your team took the initiative to have a fun and healthy competition without any external incentives. In my experience, when wellness programs are too complicated or forced, they tend to lose their effectiveness. Headline: Founder,Soultripp | Certified üçÑ coach guiding hustlers break free from burnout & rat-race with level-up getaways | NSRCEL IIMB, ex-KPMG
Comment:
This reminded me of pushup challenges I did back when I was working at KPMG and nudged me to do some today üí™üèΩ 

According to recent stats, https://www.livemint.com/news/trends/only-14-indian-workers-thriving-rest-suffering-or-struggling-gallup-workplace-report-11718204098083.html, a whopping 86% of Indian workforce say they are struggling. 

From my first hand experience of recovering from stress and burnout, I realised wellness travel experiences helped immensely and this led me to building Zencations club. I hope to be a part of the rainmatter ecosystem so we can serve more professionals in their wellness practice.

Headline: Finance Expert | Fin-Techie | Founder | Helping Families Recover Wealth Faster
Comment:
Dilip Kumar Have always been a fan of how you folks promote employee physical health. Kudos üëè 

Another thing that can be done: Promote financial hygiene of the employees. Not for returns or savings, too many people are already doing it but for ensuring their existing savings/investments are in order and secured so that the pain the families have to go through while claiming can be reduced.

We are doing a 60-minute session on "Demystifying Inheritance" for corporates/companies.

Probably you do not need us and can do it internally, but your promotion of its importance will be a light bearer for everyone else.
